Title.evidence: We therefore performed a randomized controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: We randomly allocated 50 patients to one of the two approaches.

Participants.evidence: patients 65 years and older with four-part humeral fractures

Intervention.evidence: treated either nonoperatively or with hemiarthroplasty.

Objective.evidence: to compare (1) function, (2) strength, and (3) pain and disability

Method_Outcome.evidence: The Constant-Murley score was the primary outcome measure.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomly allocated 50 patients to one of the two approaches.

Result_Outcome.evidence: We found no between-group differences in Constant-Murley and Simple Shoulder Test scores at 3- and 12-months followup.

Harms.evidence: the nonoperatively treated patients experienced more pain at 3 months
